thread.title: Ground News - 'A huge shock to the system': Doctors warn about asthma inhaler switch coming in January
thread.title_full: Ground News - 'A huge shock to the system': Doctors warn about asthma inhaler switch coming in January

author: KCRA 3
title: Ground News - 'A huge shock to the system': Doctors warn about asthma inhaler switch coming in January
text:
Summary by KCRA 3 Starting Jan. 1, a brand of asthma inhaler will disappear from pharmacy shelves, and doctors are concerned patients may have delays switching to alternatives. Share menu More
Filters 42 Articles 42 Articles All Left Center Right
CNN Lean Left High Factuality Media Conglomerate: Warner Bros. Discovery ‘A huge shock to the system’: Doctors warn about asthma inhaler switch coming in January Starting January 1, a drug that thousands of patients depend on to help them breathe will disappear from pharmacy shelves, and doctors are concerned patients may have delays switching to alternatives and getting them covered by insurance.
11 hours ago · Atlanta, United States Read Full Article
CNN Lean Left High Factuality Media Conglomerate: Warner Bros. Discovery
‘A huge shock to the system’: Doctors warn about asthma inhaler switch coming in January Starting January 1, a drug that thousands of patients depend on to help them breathe will disappear from pharmacy shelves, and doctors are concerned patients may have delays switching to alternatives and getting them covered by insurance.
11 hours ago · Atlanta, United States Read Full Article KRDO Center High Factuality Media Conglomerate: News-Press & Gazette Company ‘A huge shock to the system’: Doctors warn about asthma inhaler switch coming in January (CNN) — Starting January 1, a drug that thousands of patients depend on to help them breathe will disappear from pharmacy shelves, and doctors are concerned patients may have delays switching to alternatives and getting them covered by insurance. Manufacturer GSK has said it’s discontinuing the branded asthma inhaler Flovent, and instead is making an “authorized generic” version, which is identical but without the same branding.
